There is a Java-based JRuby implementation of the fast ruby debugger rdebug.

1. Manually download the ruby-debug-base-0.10.1-java.gem from [http://rubyforge.org/frs/?group_id=3085 debug-commons] to a local directory.

2. Install the Gem into your JRuby Gem repository:
  jruby -S gem install -l ruby-debug-base-0.10.1-java.gem

3. Now install ruby-debug with: 
  jruby -S gem install --ignore-dependencies -v 0.10.1 ruby-debug
  jruby -S gem install --ignore-dependencies ruby-debug-ide # needed only for IDEs

'''Note''': <tt>--debug</tt> options used below works only with JRuby 1.1.2. More over there is a [http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/JRUBY-2664 bug] on Windows so <tt>--debug</tt> the flag works there only with JRuby trunk. Thus you need to stick with the old option, using <tt>-J-Djruby.reflection=true -J-Djruby.compile.mode=OFF</tt> instead <tt>--debug</tt> on Windows or older JRuby releases (1.1.1 and lower).

Starting the debugger on a Rails application:

  $ cd my_rails_app
  $ jruby --debug -S rdebug script/server

* [http://bashdb.sourceforge.net/ruby-debug.html Debugging with ruby-debug]
